discussion.content: The answer is B and D

questions.question_text:
As a project manager, you use spreadsheets to keep track of multiple projects. As you took responsibility of more projects, you became tired of managing them in spreadsheets.
You have collated all of your project data in one single spreadsheet. You also want to maintain the data in an Oracle Database table by using an Oracle APEX application.
Which two actions can you take? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Use SQL Workshop > Utilities > Data Workshop to load the data into a new table, and then use the Create Application Wizard to create an application on the new table.
choices.E: Create a new table by using SQL Workshop > Object Browser > Create Table, and then use the Create Application Wizard to create an application based on the new table.
choices.D: Use the Create Application Wizard and select "From a Spreadsheet."
choices.A: Define a Data Loading page in the Create Application Wizard.
choices.C: Create an application by using the Create Application Wizard, and then add a table for the spreadsheet data.

questions.question_text: Which is true about the Button Name attribute?

choices.B: The button name is a unique identifier on a page. No other buttons or page items on the page can have the same name.
choices.D: The button name serves as a static ID, which is useful when developing custom JavaScript functionality for the button.
choices.C: The button name defines what database action is done on page submit.
choices.A: When the page is submitted by clicking the button, the value of REQUEST is set to the button name.

discussion.content:
Not B - you can have button and page item with the same name (Tested)
So the answer should be A

Yes it's A
Yes it's A

A is correct. B is wrong - it says that no other button OR PAGE ITEMS. Page items can have same names as buttons. 
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/HTMDB/bldapp_but.htm#HTMDB25447

questions.question_text:
Taylor has created a report and form on the STATUS table.
She wants only application administrators to be able to access the report and form.
What must she do to achieve this?

discussion.content: D for Authorization Scheme. The authentication scheme option is a part of Shared Components -> Security.

choices.D: Select authorization scheme of Administration Rights

questions.question_text:
Jules is trying to implement Session State Protection to increase the security of Jules' application.
On which three components can Jules configure Session State Protection in Oracle Application Express? (Choose three.)
Which set of components do you need to add breadcrumb navigation to an existing application?

choices.B: navigation list, breadcrumb, and breadcrumb entries
choices.D: breadcrumb, breadcrumb entries, and navigation regions
choices.C: breadcrumb, breadcrumb entries, and breadcrumb regions
choices.A: navigation list, breadcrumb region, and breadcrumb entries
